comments: Color Puzzle 23 - 'For one and for all!'
You may have noticed that you frequently do three things when you use a while loop:
Declare and initialize a counter variable, declare the while loop, and increment the counter
For loops allow you to do all three tasks in a single line
Note the shorthand of x++ is equal to x = x + 1
drawPixel(x, y, color): draws the pixel at the coordinate (x,y) the given color
